channel.title: [Tutorial] How to add shops to PI
channel.description:
Hello, Moparscape members today im going to be releasing a tutorial on how to put shops on your server with a PI Source.
Requirements: Pi Source/Common Sense
Difficulty Level: 1/10 -----------------------------------------
Lets get started yea?
First thing first go into your PI source and start your server up and go to your webclient and login. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 2nd thing to do is make a NPC that you want as a shop. Example: [img]http://i1037.photobucket.com/albums/a460/MDCMadman/560854646756.png[/img] ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 3rd thing to do is go back into your source files and search for ActionHandler.java \src\server\model\players Open up ActionHandler.java and continue to the next step. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 4th thing to do is make a new case Search for something like this: [img]http://i1037.photobucket.com/albums/a460/MDCMadman/28422518688.png[/img]
Make a new case: Example: case 541: c.getShops().openShop(5); break;
Another Example: case (NPC ID): c.getShops().openShop(Shop Number); break;
Keep This Part Open Next part well explain why. ------------------------------------------------------------------------ Step 5 Opening up shops.cfg
Ok now open up shops.cfg and you well see a bunch of numbers in there already unless you have a blank source.
Now the reason you keep actionhandler.java open is because this part is where you get the shop number.
Ok Lets get started. You should see already something like this at the top: //-----ShopID---ShopName-------- >> And so on
Ok Here ill make you guys a basic code for your shop Make sure you guys tab in these by the way. Example: shop = 20 Rare_Shop 2 2 14484 100 1050 30 1057 30 1042 30 1040 30
14484 is dragon claws ID and it sells 100 of them. 1050 is santa hat and sells 30 of them. And so on. Now go back up to step 4 and where it says (shop number) Put 20 in there. Then were done with that part and save both notepads. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Step 6 setting the spawn-config for the npcs.
Open up spawn-config its in the same folder as shops.cfg
Once you have it open you well see a bunch of spawn codes. Well thats what we have to do for our shop to spawn when you turn on the server.
Example: // spawnX spawnY height walk maxhit attack defence description spawn = 555 3089 3492 0 0 0 0 0 0 Rare Shop Do not put spawnx in the first line where spawn = 555 It might confuse you a bit it did to me first too
The 555 is the NPC ID and 3089 is the SpawnX and SpawnY is 3492 Once you have this done save the notepad and exit that --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Step 7 and final open up prices.txt in the same folder as shops.cfg
Ok so open up prices.txt and once you have it open you well see a bunch of numbers
lets say you want to make a price for D Clawz First Line: 14484 1300000000 (1.3b) And if you want to make more prices go ahead The prices might already be in there so just do Ctrl F And Search the code Once you have this part done then save this prices.txt and go to your first page of your source and compile it then run then walla you have your own shop. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

item.title: [Tutorial] How to add shops to PI
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

i guess its good
but there are already plenty tuts of this, and it can be guessed by just lookin’ at the code.
anyways… good work?

Read full topic
item.source: [Tutorial] How to add shops to PI

item.title: [Tutorial] How to add shops to PI
item.dc:creator: @Zonebird Zonebird
item.description:
@Zonebird wrote:

Hello, Moparscape members today im going to be releasing a tutorial on how to put shops on your server with a PI Source.

Requirements: Pi Source/Common Sense

Difficulty Level: 1/10

Lets get started yea?

First thing first go into your PI source and start your server up and go to your webclient and login.

2nd thing to do is make a NPC that you want as a shop.
Example:
560854646756.png764×502

3rd thing to do is go back into your source files and search for ActionHandler.java \src\server\model\players
Open up ActionHandler.java and continue to the next step.

4th thing to do is make a new case
Search for something like this:

28422518688.png1009×444

Make a new case:
Example:
case 541:
c.getShops().openShop(5);
break;

Another Example:
case (NPC ID):
c.getShops().openShop(Shop Number);
break;

Keep This Part Open Next part well explain why.

Step 5 Opening up shops.cfg

Ok now open up shops.cfg and you well see a bunch of numbers in there already unless you have a blank source.

Now the reason you keep actionhandler.java open is because this part is where you get the shop number.

Ok Lets get started.
You should see already something like this at the top: //-----ShopID—ShopName-------- >> And so on

Ok Here ill make you guys a basic code for your shop
Make sure you guys tab in these by the way.
Example:
shop = 20 Rare_Shop 2 2 14484 100 1050 30 1057 30 1042 30 1040 30

14484 is dragon claws ID and it sells 100 of them.
1050 is santa hat and sells 30 of them.
And so on.
Now go back up to step 4 and where it says (shop number) Put 20 in there.
Then were done with that part and save both notepads.

Step 6 setting the spawn-config for the npcs.

Open up spawn-config its in the same folder as shops.cfg

Once you have it open you well see a bunch of spawn codes.
Well thats what we have to do for our shop to spawn when you turn on the server.

Example:
// spawnX spawnY height walk maxhit attack defence description
spawn = 555 3089 3492 0 0 0 0 0 0 Rare Shop
Do not put spawnx in the first line where spawn = 555
It might confuse you a bit it did to me first too

The 555 is the NPC ID and 3089 is the SpawnX and SpawnY is 3492
Once you have this done save the notepad and exit that

Step 7 and final open up prices.txt in the same folder as shops.cfg

Ok so open up prices.txt and once you have it open you well see a bunch of numbers

lets say you want to make a price for D Clawz
First Line:
14484 1300000000 (1.3b)
And if you want to make more prices go ahead
The prices might already be in there so just do Ctrl F
And Search the code
Once you have this part done then save this prices.txt and go to your first page of your source and compile it then run then walla you have your own shop.

Read full topic
item.source: [Tutorial] How to add shops to PI
